publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday March 27, 2019 at 03:11

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of letters and writings by William Wordsworth. The autograph letters, signed, are from Wordsworth to his colleagues, friends, and family, along with Wordsworth autographs clipped from letters and documents. One letter contains an autograph addition, signed, by Samuel Taylor Coleridge. Writings in the collection are by Wordsworth, in his hand and that of his sister Dorothy Wordsworth and wife Mary Wordsworth. Also included are groups of page proofs and two published works, Lyrical Ballads with Other Poems, vol. II (London: T. N. Longman and O. Rees, 1800), and Poems in Two Volumes (London: Longman, Hurst, Rees, and Orme, 1807), with William and Dorothy Wordsworth's autograph edits for second editions. Other Papers holds one letter from Edward Quillinan to "Miss Tudor" (1850), regarding Wordsworth's death.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Acquired from various sources. For moreinformation see the folder list below.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The William Wordsworth Collection isthe physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, YaleUniversity. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors ortheir legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriatecurator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: William Wordsworth Collection. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book andManuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety oflevels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceivedresearch value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether ornot further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basiclevel of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensiveprocessing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection includes materials previously identified by the followingcall number: MS Vault Wordsworth and Uncat MS Vault 169

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Biggs andCottle Correspondence Regarding Lyrical Ballads (GEN MSS 1261)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of lettersand writings by William Wordsworth. The autograph letters, signed, are fromWordsworth to his colleagues, friends, and family, along with Wordsworthautographs clipped from letters and documents. One letter contains an autographaddition, signed, by Samuel Taylor Coleridge. Writings in the collection are byWordsworth, in his hand and that of his sister Dorothy Wordsworth and wife MaryWordsworth. Also included are corrected page proofs and a volume of poemsWordsworth edited for a second edition. Other Papers holds one letter fromEdward Quillinan to Miss Tudor, regarding Wordsworth's death.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organizedinto three series: I. Correspondence and Autographs, 1798-1850. II. Writings,1815-1844. III. Other Papers, 1850.

controlaccess.subject: Poets, English -- 19th century
controlaccess.persname: Wordsworth, William, 1770-1850 ( Earlier poems of William Wordsworth)

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: WilliamWordsworth and Mary Wordsworth.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series Icontains autograph letters, signed, from William Wordsworth to his colleagues,friends, and family, along with Wordsworth autographs clipped from letters anddocuments. One letter contains an autograph addition, signed, by Samuel TaylorColeridge. Also present is one autograph letter, signed, by Mary Wordsworth.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two autographnotes giving instructions to the printer of his Poems , published by Moxon in1845. The notes were written on and subsequently clipped from the proofs ofthis edition which were sent to the poet for his approval.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bound volume without title pages and contents, annotated throughout withautograph corrections and revisions by William Wordsworth, Dorothy Wordsworth,and an unidentified person, in preparation for the edition of 1802. Autographof Christopher Wordsworth.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bound volume with extensive autographcorrections and textual interpolations by Wordsworth, used in preparing the1815 edition of his poems.

did.unittitle: Group of page proofs with autograph corrections

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sheets of the 1815 edition, correctedby Wordsworth in preparation for the edition of 1820, comprising Volume Ifly-title to page 82 (lacking pages 61-62). and Volume II pages 83-96 and298-356 (lacking 315-316, 353-354, and one leaf between 320 and327).

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous Poems of William Wordsworth in FourVolumes (1820)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sixteen pages of proofs prepared by Wordsworthfor volume III, comprising pages 197-212 (200 and 201 not numbered);corrections and additions in Wordsworth's hand except for page206.

did.unittitle: Memorials of a Tour on the Continent, 1820 (1822)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Forty-eight pages of corrected proofs with ten pages of original manuscript,(mostly in Mary Wordsworth's hand) for incorporation in thevolume.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sixty pages of corrected proofscomprising pages 65 to 124, with autograph manuscript of the Advertisement,signed and dated January 24, 1822
